target_text: "But for the purpose of a definition, I would say quality takes place in the process level and the software level."

Agreed.justification: All roles (Software Developer, UX/UI Designer, Project Manager, QA Engineer, DevOps Engineer) emphasize quality at the process level, highlighting workflows, CI/CD, and iterative methodologies as critical to ensuring quality.
All roles acknowledge quality at the software level, focusing on codebase integrity, functionality, performance, and user-facing attributes like accessibility and aesthetics.

Disagreed.justification: Unique to the Software Developer, this code emphasizes multi-layered quality but lacks explicit mention in other roles, suggesting a divergence in granularity or focus.
Only the UX/UI Designer highlights the need for defining quality to align stakeholders, indicating a role-specific focus on communication and shared understanding.
Mentioned by Project Manager and QA Engineer, this code reflects a narrower focus on contextual framing, which other roles do not explicitly address.
Unique to the DevOps Engineer, this code suggests an integrated view of quality across development and operations, diverging from other roles' more segmented perspectives.
